title: Masters of doom coming to the small screen=Keen on tv maybe?
content:
[url=http://www.gamespot.com/news/2005/04/14/news_6122303.html]www.gamespot.com/news/200...22303.html[/url]

Hopefully since Keen was ID's first game they would probably spend some time on the subject. Keen was definitely on tv before on the the G4 show icons for their doom episode. Only bad thing about it was that Keen was only shown for like one second and it was just a very quick glimpse of Keen 1. Hopefully Keen will have some more screen time in this upcoming doc.

(Not sure if this would be in either the other keen stuff or Misc forum but since this does relate to keen I posted it here. Please move the topic if anyone feels like it doesn't belong here.)

title: Re: Masters of doom coming to the small screen=Keen on tv ma
content:

title: Re: Masters of doom coming to the small screen=Keen on tv ma
content: I actually have seen some gameplay of keen 1 on TV before.  g4TechTV did a show on iD software and showed about 7 seconds of the first level.  It was pretty neat!

title: Re: Masters of doom coming to the small screen=Keen on tv ma
content:

Doom: What parents? I never had any parents! I was created stand alone and complete! Are you insinuating I have 2D roots? Why you...

title: Re: Masters of doom coming to the small screen=Keen on tv ma
content:
Kid, can't you read? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smoke2.gif[/img]
John Carmack and John Romero may be portrayed in a movie adaptation of David Kushner's Masters of Doom.
Masters of Doom is a book about iD beginning, apparently focusing mostly on Doom (computer game). I haven't read that book yet.
What Superadammario64 said was that hopefully they talk more about Keen in the movie/document, since it's their first game and their real start. They talk very little about Keen in that book, and show him as kinda just some second character that hadn't much effect.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!
